item.title: Source Code
item.description: Source Code All of the mtrk source code is hosted in public Github repositories. You can find the code for the individual components in the table below or via the Github page of the mtrk Team.   Repository Content Link mtrk_seq mtrk driver sequence (requires Siemens IDEA) Open mtrk_node mtrk UI for sequence testing (based on Node.js and express.js) Open mtrk_stisla HTML/CSS theme used for the mtrk UI Open

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Frequently Asked Questions   Can I create mtrk files without generator? The mtrk format is human-readable and, therefore, it is possible to modify sequences by directly editing the file in a text editor. However, except for debugging tasks, it is generally easier to write a small program that generates the mtrk file (referred to as generator). How can I get help? Please use our Gitter Channel to get in touch (click the OPEN CHAT button on the bottom-right).

item.title: Ongoing Development Work
item.description: Welcome to the mtrk website! We decided to put this page online already at this early stage to make the development as transparent as possible. However, please be aware that the project is still under active development and that the programming work has not been completed yet. We will announce on this website when a first stable release is available. In the meantime, feel free to follow or join our development work on Github.

item.title: Disclaimer
item.description: Disclaimer The Yarra framework is provided free of charge for use in research applications. It must not be used for diagnostic applications. The authors take no responsibility of any kind for the accuracy or integrity of the created data sets. No data created using the framework should be used to make diagnostic decisions. The Yarra framework provided through this website, including all of its software components, comes without any warranties.
